— Randy Schekman

item.title: Tissue clearing methods
item.description: Introduction This webinar will explain tissue clearing, how it functions, and the three main methods for making tissues transparent. Moreover, the advantages and limitations of various tissue cleansing methods. PEGASOS (Using in our lab, recommended): PEGASOS version 1: Jing, Dian, et al. “Tissue clearing of both hard and soft tissue organs with the PEGASOS method.” Cell research 28.8 (2018): 803-818. [PDF | DOI Link] TESOS system: Yi, Yating, et al. “Mapping of individual sensory nerve axons from digits to spinal cord with the Transparent Embedding Solvent System.

item.title: Genomics and Sequencing Foundation
item.description: RNA-Seq KITS FOR RNA EXTRACTION Takara: Smart-Seq SEQUENCING PLATFORM illumina; Huada Gene ANALYSIS SOFTWARES QC fastqc; multiqc; fastp Reads Mapping HISAT2: graph-based alignment of next generation sequencing reads to a population of genomes. (Manual) STAR: The STAR software package maps large sets of high-throughput sequencing reads to a reference genome with high levels of accuracy and speed. (Manual) TopHat: TopHat is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

item.title: Imaging Foundation
item.description:
Believing is seeing and seeing is believing.
— Tom Hanks

item.title: Programming Foundation
item.description: R R-The R Project for Statistical Computing: https://www.r-project.org/ Rstudio: Rstudio Workbench is an integrated development environment for R and Python, with a console, syntax-highlighting editor that supports direct code execution, and tools for plotting, history, debugging and workspace management. RShiny: Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R. You can host standalone apps on a webpage or embed them in R Markdown documents or build dashboards.
